body.p: If you notice that some of the CSS properties were not applied as expected, some of the tips offered in this topic might help you with the debugging process.

section.title: Comparing the CSS Against the Input File
section.p: The first thing that you should try is to check the file structure of the input XML or HTML file and compare it to the CSS selectors to make sure they are written correctly against the document structure. If you still cannot identify the problem, then inspect how the styles are applied (you can try any of the methods listed below).

section.title: Inspecting the Applied Styles Using the Chrome Browser
section.sectiondiv: To inspect the applied CSS styles using Chrome:

ol.li: In Chrome, open the input XML or HTML file.
Click on the element you want to inspect.

Activate the Chrome Developer Tools by using
More Tools Developer Tools , or press CTRL+SHIFT+I.

Activate the Rendering pane by using
More Tools Rendering :
In the Rendering pane, select print from the Emulate CSS media section. This will activate the CSS selectors enclosed in @media print {..}.

section.note: This allows you to debug the styling of elements, table of contents, and index, but not the styles of the page margin boxes (headers, footers) or page breaks.

In the left pane of the Developer Tools interface, you can inspect elements and their styles in the Elements tab. You can click on any of the links to display the applied CSS files in the Styles tab in the right pane. Editing the styles in that pane results in a live preview of how the change will affect the output.

section.title: Inspecting the Applied Styles Using Oxygen XML Editor/Author

ol.li: In Oxygen XML Editor/Author, open the input XML or HTML file.
[Optional] From the Styles toolbar, choose the + Print Ready entry. This will activate certain CSS selectors enclosed in @media print {..}.
Click on the element you want to style. Use the Inspect Styles action from the Contextual Menu. A specialized CSS Inspector view will show the built-in CSS rules.

section.note: With this file open in Author mode, it might be helpful to switch the Tags Display Mode to Full Tags with Attributes. You might be able to identify the selector you need to style without using the CSS Inspector view.
This allows you to debug styling of elements, but not of the page margin boxes (headers, footers) or page breaks.
Do not modify the built-in rules directly in the CSS files from the Oxygen XML Editor/Author installation. Instead, copy the rules to your own customization CSS.

section.title: Other techniques
section.p: These are some other techniques you may find useful:

ul.li: Add background and borders properties to the specific CSS rule. If they do not appear in the output then there is a problem with the rule selector.
Try to use the !important notation to the property that is not applied, or make the selector more specific (you can add more parent selectors).
